page.title: 07CRANLEIGH VILLAGE HOSPITAL
page.content: The villagers of Cranleigh have just 'saved' their hospital from closure for the second time in ten years. In 1859 the village surgeon decided that a journey by rough cart to the nearest hospital was often fatal and thanks to the generosity of the Rector was able to establish the first cottage hospital in England. Now after extentions in 1922, 1930 and 1982, mainly paid for by local people, it has about 24 patients, mainy post_operative or elderly. The patients are visited daily by doctors of the Cranleigh Health Centre and specialists visit to see outpatients. The new extention houses a day centre for elderly who are brought in by ambulance. They receive physio_ therapy, chiropody, occupational therapy and general care while being able to live at home.
